title: Civil War Defenses of Washington: 127th Pennsylvania Regiment List
body: 127th Pennsylvania Regiment Company I       Recruited in Adams County, Pennsylvania 127th PA Regiment Co. I Captain Ira R. Shipley  Christian A. Nissley  1st Lieutenant. Jas. S. Shoemaker Jerome W. Henry  2d Lt.  Wm. W. Reed  1st Sergeant Charles G. Miller Augustus A. Welsh David Early Sam'l G. Sheaffer John M. Segner  Corporal George A. Wolf R'ben K. Newhard Michael Baker Shade G. Stevens Jacob Stambaugh Joseph Early William S. Myers William A. Forney  Musician Simon Wheeler Edward F. A. Clark  Private Arnold, Eli Alexander Francis Auge, Valentine Blasser, Andrew Baer, Daniel Baker, Daniel L. Black, Jacob Becker, Martin Bachman, Peter Black, Daniel Bupp, Joseph T. Cilley, John Day, George Davis, James M. Druckenmiller, A. Early, Benj. W. Fickle, Thaddeus Frantz, Adam Fidell, Francis Gelvin, John Gardner, Theo.  Heikes, John E. Hanson, Christian Jones, Michael Kindt, Anthony Livingston, Wm. Livingston, Jas.W. Loser, Jacob Lentz, Alfred Lessley, John Lillienstine, Chas. Lentz, Eli Menear, Edward J. Myers, Daniel S. Mumper, Levi Miller, John H. Mark, John G. Miller, Daniel Myer, Henry Moneghan, John Mondorff, David Myers, Jacob H. Nipple, Jeremiah Neiif, Joseph Norman, Edward Osborne, John H. Packhan, Bradd Rupp, Henry Robb, John A. Rankin, William Rhodes, Henry Stough, Joseph Sheaffer, John W. Stevens, Edward Sheaffer, Jacob S. Shutt, John I. Shultz, John A. Sheaffer, Jacob Trimmer, Andrew Vernosdale, Uriah Welsh, George W. Wendling, Adam Weltmer, Martin Walborn, Elijah Wieirman, Joseph E. Wilhelm, Lewis Young, James Yann, John  Roster Source: Bates, Samuel P. (Samuel Penniman), 1827-1902.: History of Pennsylvania Volunteers, 1861-5; prepared in compliance with acts of the legislature, by Samuel P. Bates.   Contributed by George Rapp
